system
Class Player

java.lang.Object
  system.MapObject
      system.LivingUnit
          system.Player
All Implemented Interfaces:
Destructible, Moveable
public class Player
extends LivingUnit

The class Player and represents all the characteristics of the player. It extends the class LivingUnit. It sets the number of lives the player has, the number of bombs the player has and the size of the explosion.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Brett Leighton, Leotard Niyonkuru, Marc-Andre Cataford, Mete Kemertas, Martin Zhang

die

public void die()
This method sets the conditions of the player when the player dies. It resets the player's co-ordinates, decreases the number of lives and resets the blast radius and number of bombs.

isActive

public boolean isActive()
This method gets the condition of the player.

Returns:
Returns true if the player is the active player and false otherwise.

setActive

public void setActive(boolean isActive)
This method sets the player condition depending on the isActive method.

Parameters:
isActive - This takes as input a boolean isActive and sets the player Active if its true and false otherwise.

consume

public void consume(Powerup powerup)
This method sets what happens when the player consumes a powerup. Depending on the powerup consumed, the player will increase either maxBombs or blastRadius.

Parameters:
powerup - It takes as input the powerup consumed.
